page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: { One cursus was visible in the 1984 drought-near Kilncroft.Others lie behind Gowanlea and Kilncroft and a lesser shape on the banks of the Cairn {Druid Circle }A stone circle called TheTwelve Apostles dates back more years BC than we are AD. Its 11 stones are 26O ft in diam.,are above running water,aligned to the sun at the summer solstice and part of a ley line.The stones weigh up to 12 tons,and are chiefly of greywacke. {HOLYWOOD CHURCH }The Church was built in 1779 in the grounds of the former Abbey of Holywood or Darcongal-an aesthetic enthusiast associated with the old oak wood which gave Holywood its name.Recently tunnels were noticed leading from the graveyard possibly to the old Lincluden Abbey.Village street names are Abbey place and Darcongal rd
